column4: help : i have followed every tutorial i can find about watching DVD's...but still, when i put in a dvd in my laptop, it doesn't even pop up on my desktop!  please help!
help : i have followed every tutorial i can find about watching DVD's...but still, when i put in a dvd in my laptop, it doesn't even pop up on my desktop!  please help!
You want a dvd to popup in an app when you put the movie in the drive?
i just want it to play dvds
System -> Preferences -> Removable Drives and Media
i don't want it to set to automatically play, i just want it to work :P
So, you don't want the movie auto play, but you want the app to popup on the desktop so you can play the movie???
no lol...it won't play dvds...i'm just mentioning that it doesn't pop up on the desktop as a clue to why it won't play...i'm thinking it might not recognize dvd's or something
i just want to be able to play dvds on my laptop
Ok, here's how to get the icon to popup on the desktop. Applications -> System -> Configuration editor. Open that and let me know when it's open
When the conf editor is open, go to the left pane and go to apps/nautilus/desktop
Run gmplayer, go to the prefs, go to the Misc tab and at the bottom, set your dirves up
i can't...when i run it, it just locks up, doesn't even give me menus to click on or anythhing, just two blank boxes
Are you using gnome with xgl or compiz?
Did you install mplayer from the repos?
